meanings.definition: A thin slice of meat, typically veal or pork, that is coated in breadcrumbs and fried.
meanings.sent1: I ordered escalopes for dinner at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: My mom makes delicious escalopes with breadcrumbs and meat.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the escalopes on the floor, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The escalopes sizzled in the hot oil, filling the kitchen with a tempting aroma.
meanings.sent5: The escalopes were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

meanings.definition: To prepare meat by slicing it thinly and pounding it to make it tender.
meanings.sent1: She carefully escalopes the chicken before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: In cooking class, we learned how to escalopes the meat for the dish.
meanings.sent3: He escalopes the beef with enthusiasm, enjoying the process.
meanings.sent4: The chef escalopes the steak with precision, ensuring it will be juicy.
meanings.sent5: Escaloping the meat requires patience and a good mallet.
